thread.title: San Francisco 49ers hire three more assistant coaches
thread.title_full: San Francisco 49ers hire three more assistant coaches

author: Kirk Larrabee
title: San Francisco 49ers hire three more assistant coaches
text:
San Francisco 49ers hire three more assistant coaches Taylor Embree, Mike McDaniel, and Mike LaFleur all join the 49ers coaching staff. Slot to San Francisco 49ers Newsletter Newsletter 
The San Francisco 49ers announced the official hiring of three more assistant coaches on Monday: offensive quality control coach Taylor Embree, wide receivers coach Mike LaFleur, and run game specialist Mike McDaniel. 
Embree, 28, is the son of recently-hired 49ers tight ends coach Jon Embree. Embree broke into coaching as a graduate assistant at UCLA in 2014, which is also where he played college ball as a receiver from 2008 to 2011. Embree was a defensive assistant with the Kansas City Chiefs in 2016. 
LaFleur and McDaniel follow new head coach Kyle Shanahan to San Francisco from Atlanta. LaFleur, 29, has been with Shanahan for the past three seasons as he was a an offensive coaching intern with the Cleveland Browns in 2014 while Shanahan was Browns offensive coordinator and was an offensive assistant in Atlanta the past two seasons. LaFleur has also been a college assistant at Davidson, Saint Joseph's College, and Elmhurst College. 
McDaniel, 33, has been an assistant during each of Shanahan's four offensive coordinator stints (Atlanta, Cleveland, Washington, Houston). McDaniel, who is a product of Yale University, was an offensive assistant for the Falcons the past two seasons, the wide receivers coach in Cleveland in 2014, an offensive assistant in Washington in 2011 and 2012 and receivers coach in 2013, and an offensive assistant with the Texans from 2006 to 2008. Author
